post_title: Gd stepping stone to understand shipbuilding.
text: Pros: -Able to experience shipbuilding from start to end. -some are friendly to work with. Cons: - First job after uni , lasted 3 years. should have left much earlier. I regret now! -Expects you to do overtime (OT) all the time including sat and sun, but pay 8/hr. -Have to work minimum 5-6 years to get first promotion and decent pay raise. - Entry level degree with pass is $2800 (way way below national average for a local degree holder) -Low pay with yearly increment of $8-$10. after 3 years you will leave with almost same pay as started. -If you are extremely lucky , you will get a Singaporean colleague. -extremely rigid environment where a minute late will be penalized from your salary. it doesn't matter if you have worked till 10pm the night before. -extremely high turn over rate mostly young Singaporeans leaving the company for a brighter future. -All courses conducted are in-house and there is hardly any external courses you will go. no proper certified certification given that is recognized outside the organization. If its expensive course, they will most probably bond you to the organization. - management ignores any request made by employees but will ask for suggestions. - there is a lot of self-learning as there is no frame work to teach you anything -no career growth in terms of salary and position for 5-6 years. -don't expect to hear ' welfare ' - will say 'family is important and to leave early to spent time with them' but will load you with work and will judge you if you leave early no matter how efficient you are in completing you work. Even if you have no work, you are expected to do overtime to show commitment to work. If not, forget about bonus. -Many who left the company are happy and not looking back. -work starts at 7.30am-5.15pm - lunch break is strictly 45mins. -2 way company transport is provided and payable $1 on return trip -getting shouted or getting advice is normal from under performing managers/management. - unspoken HR policy is something like this, 'everyone is replaceable by innocent fresh grads , Malaysian or Chinese national'. - oil market is down , but work never go down but bonus and increment is almost zero. -Wish current and future employee to find a purpose working here and gd luck. adios!

Pros: Good exposure to shipyard building. Many things to learn if you are willing and know where to learn from.. Cons: First job since graduate. The management views employee's quality and productivity is based on the number of OT you do rather then outcome or project output. Work life balance is nearly non-existent and there is no benefit to re compensate. When a project is running late, "on fire" , all resource are thrown to fix the problem. Higher management will then do daily OT meetings to mirco manage everything in hopes of speeding up the process but ends up wasting time and resource. Very high turn over rate. Its a Singapore company in Singapore but majority of the employees are foreigners. Can't name more than 20 Singaporeans colleagues in the production line even though i have been working for 3 years. There is no technical training and everything is learnt on the job. Basically you are thrown into the sea and expected to learn to swim. If not, be expected to drown
Pros: Great platform for fresh grad to grind through.. Cons: -old fashioned management style -engineers are purely just a tool to issue drawings to meet schedule -design work are not appreciated

Pros: There is no pro at all! Think again n again before you join . And join at ur own ricks. Cons: The last place for u to come. Think really twice thrice and forever to come here! Everything is just too bad

Pros: Nothing great experience here to mention. If lucky get helpful college. Bus from boon lay for free but going back need to pay $1.... Cons: -HR department treats engineers like foreign labour and the manager and rest feels its all right. -system very rigid and regimental -bad working culture and attitude -they have suggestion scheme for ISO purpose and its a eyewash for the outsider. Nothing of employee interest will be taken into consideration and try to implement -this is not a singapore company that says it represents singapore ( its is publicity and showing off) -company is filled with 75% foreigners and PRs and 15% true singaporean -national day observation ceremony attended mostly by PRs and new citizen while most singaporean are working in office. -ns contribution is not taken into account when they negotiate the pay. -no flexible working hours -not appreciative -pay rise is pathetic. $10- $15 per year!!! ( one Mac meal cost $9.50) -basic pay is below national average for degree holder ($2750 to $2850) -if private degree, the pay starts from $2500 -foreigners are given better pay because HR says local have CPF contribution. Hence the take home pay for foreigners are much higher. -pay deduction for every minute late. -like labour, everyone has to punch card when entering office. -if the system fails, it's the employee fault. -contract employee are paid way better than permanent employee. But its the permanent employee who leads the project. This just don't make sense. -you will never get to attend enrichment courses on work related nor non work related like other companies. -high turnover rate.. max employees stay 2-3years and they leave. -when the bell rings we need to run for bus - military marching song is played everyday and is irritating. -no prospect or overseas opportunity to work.

post_title: Need to improve talent development and retention
text: Pros: High variable bonus. Free company bus transport. Free in house clinic. Stable working time: 7:30am to 5:15pm. For those who loves gigantic ships, there are many international ships that dock there for servicing. Sometimes, we get to play telematch games with ship crew. The employees get to show case their in house projects that either improve work procsss, enhance safety or reduce cost.. Cons: No public bus transport to office. Last company bus to Tuas yard is 6:45am. If you missed the company bus, then you either take taxi to Tuas yard or report to Jurong ship yard and take the internal bus to Tuas yard. About 45 minutes by company bus ride from Jurong Point to Tuas. Chinese mixed rice in canteen is not cheap. HR is unresponsive to your email enquiries. Need to send reminder email to them to get their attention on your enquiries.

post_title: Last place to go for a job
text: Pros: Able to gain technical knowledge easily Employee benefits are average. Cons: Conservative way of working environment Extremely slow career progression (Promotion depends on years of staying) Long working hours Work-life is never balance
Pros: There it is a lot to learn and develop my skills and i used to get yearly bonus and profit bonus.S. Cons: Safety of the Employee
